intro: Schizanthus duodecemfidus, commonly known as the twelve-lobed begonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers, which come in a range of colors, are bilaterally symmetrical and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
